required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Aripiprazole and Lexapro Drug Interaction Study
clinical_study.official_title: Effects on Aripiprazole on the Steady-State Pharmacokinetics of Escitalopram in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this clinical research study is to learn whether aripiprazole has effect on the steady-state pharmacokinetics of escitalopram in healthy subjects. The safety and tolerability of aripiprazole and escitalopram co-administration will also be studied.

primary_outcome.measure: Multiple dose PK parameters for Lexapro when administered alone and coadministered with aripiprazole will be derived. Cmin for aripiprazole,dehydro-aripiprazole will be measured

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety will be based on review of AEs, VS, ECGs, physical exam, clinical labs

intervention.intervention_name: Escitalopram on days -7 to day 14; Aripiprazole dosed starting Day 1 to day 14: 3 days at 10 mg, 4 days at 15 mg and 7 days at 20 mg
intervention.description: Tablets, Oral, Escitalopram: 10 mg; Aripiprazole: 10, 15, 20 mg, once daily, 14 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male and female subjects, ages 18 to 45. (WOCBP) must be using an adequate method of contraception to avoid pregnancy throughout the study and for up to 4 weeks after the study in such a manner that the risk of pregnancy in minimized.
- Body Mass Index (BMI) of 18 to 33 kg/m2 inclusive.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with a decrease in SBP of >=20 mm Hg and increase in HR of >=20 bpm after 2 minutes standing vs. 2 minutes supine at screening or with frank orthostatic hypotension at screening.
- Supine BP of 90/50 mm Hg or lower at screening.

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm
